questions.promptMd: Which default MOST respects autonomy while improving adoption?

answers.contentMd: Opt‑in pre‑checked for a trial with clear benefits, easy opt‑out, and reminder before billing
Provide ten near‑identical options to avoid bias

questions.promptMd: True or False: Progressive disclosure supports better decisions by revealing detail when motivation is higher.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Stage information so essentials come first, details later.
Dumping detail early increases load and stalls adoption.

questions.promptMd: A pricing page shows three curated plans with a "Recommended" middle tier. What additional design MOST improves informed choice?

answers.contentMd: Comparison table with criteria matched to persona needs
answers.feedbackMd: Enables reasoned evaluation across relevant attributes.

answers.contentMd: Auto‑select the highest tier on checkout
Use a countdown timer on all tiers
answers.feedbackMd: Manufactured urgency distracts from informed choice.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Good defaults should be easy to discover, reverse, and explain.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Transparency and reversibility are essential.
Hidden defaults breed distrust and backlash.
